Question
========
  
Spatial perception is measured on a scale from 0 to 10. The scores on this test are normally distributed with a mean of 5 and a standard deviation of 1.5. A group of 9th grade students are tested for spatial perception. SPSS was used to obtain descriptive statistics of the spatial perception scores in the sample. 

![](uu-Effect-size-809-en-tabel.png)


Using Î± = 0.01, the mean score is significantly different from 5. What is the effect size that should be reported?

  
Answerlist
----------
* 2.83 
* 0.67
* 3.33 
* 12 



Solution
========

$d=\frac{6-5}{1.5}=0.67$
